# Setup

```{r library}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(DatawRappr)
library(jakpoststyle)
```

# Data

```{r data}
data <- iris
```

# Datawrapper

Authorize the access to The Jakarta Post's Datawrapper API.

```{r api key}
api_key <- "key"
datawrapper_auth(api_key, overwrite = T)
```

Create a chart and upload the data.

```{r chart}
# Create the chart
chart <- dw_create_chart(
  title = "title",
  type = "type",
  theme = "datawrapper"
)

# Retrieve the chart id
chart_id <- chart$id

# Upload the data to the chart
dw_data_to_chart(data, chart_id)
```

# Edit chart properties

Apply the theme.

```{r theme}
jp_dw_theme(
  chart_id,
  author = "author",
  intro = "description",
  source_name = "name",
  source_url = "url"
)
```

Modify the x-axis.

```{r x-axis}
jp_dw_scale_x(
  chart_id,
  format = "auto",
  axis_line = FALSE
)
```

Modify the y-axis.

```{r y-axis}
jp_dw_scale_y(
  chart_id,
  y_var = "val",
  max = max(y_var, na.rm = T),
  min = "min"
)
```

Add COVID-19 pandemic annotations.

```{r pandemic annotations}
jp_dw_c19_annotation(
  chart_id,
  y_position = NA
)
```

# Publish chart

```{r publish}
dw_publish_chart(chart_id)
```
